column3: Slafborn's brow is clouded with worry and the forecast calls for rain─unless you can save the day.

The guildhests go unanswered as the adventurers of Revenant's Toll each pursue their separate quests, the camaraderie of their shared craft all but forgotten. One cannot underestimate the effect of a luminary such as yourself joining a guildhest, namely the hunt for a gil turtle.

*The guildhest “Hero on the Halfshell” can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
You and other intrepid adventurers completed the guildhest, tired but triumphant. Report the happy news to Slafborn.

Slafborn is pleased with the excitement your action has stirred among the adventurers of the Toll. With a greater sense of fellowship comes greater strength─a fact that Slafborn, always scanning the horizon for shadows of Garlemald, is all too mindful of.
Complete the guildhest “Hero on the Halfshell.”
What to do, what to do… ah, adventurer. Mayhap you can cut through this knot of ours.
Revenant's Toll grows yet does not prosper. We draw adventurers from far and wide─or rather, the Allagan ruins draw them.
So busy are they collecting stones and relics that they've no time for calls from the Adventurers' Guild. I fear that many who come to the Toll have no sense that we <Emphasis>are</Emphasis> a guild!
You visit Rowena's establishment, do you not? That's the kind of bustle and camaraderie I'd like to see at the Guild!
Now, tales of your derring-do are certainly known to all. You're the genuine article, and I'd ask humbly for you to render some service to the Guild in this matter.
Might you join a guildhest, and show others the glory and the honor of these undertakings?
The Adventurers' Guild currently seeks valiant volunteers to capture gil turtles. You are the <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>=man</If> to inspire others to join you in this 'hest.

The guildhests are not for me to discuss. For that, you must seek out a <Color(-34022)>hestmete</Color> in hamlets around the three city-states. Completing this behest would no doubt do wonders for the Scions' esteem for the Guild as well…
There is a guildhest at the present, seeking volunteers to capture gil turtles. What it would do for the Adventurers' Guild to have someone of your standing spearhead such a 'hest!

To know more of this, you must seek out a <Color(-34022)>hestmete</Color> in hamlets around the three city-states. Completing this behest would no doubt do wonders for the Scions' esteem for the Guild as well…
Welcome back, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! The Adventurers' Guild has marked the completion of this behest, and honors your service.

Already, the Toll buzzes with talk of the 'hest and the impromptu fellowship born of it. Not a few adventurers have already joined a guildhest. This is your doing, and you have served your Guild well!
